title: MySQLSEC_TO_TIME()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLSEC_TO_TIME()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return a time value based on a specified seconds value:
SELECT SEC_TO_TIME(1);

Definition and Usage
The SEC_TO_TIME() function returns a time value (in format HH:MM:SS) based on 
the specified seconds.
Syntax
SEC_TO_TIME(
seconds
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
seconds
Required. The number of seconds. Both positive or negative values are 
    allowed
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return a time value based on a specified seconds value:
SELECT SEC_TO_TIME(-6897);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLSEC_TO_TIME()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLSEC_TO_TIME()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLSEC_TO_TIME()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
